articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Gambian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Gambian President

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, in a message on Monday congratulated Yaya A.J.J. Jammeh on his reelection as Gambian president. 
					
					 It is his belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Gambia will grow stronger, Kim said in the message, sincerely wishing the president greater success in his responsible work for social progress and economic development.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Lao Ambassador
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Lao Ambassador

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly Choe Thae Bok on Tuesday had a talk with Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Chaleune Warinthrasak who paid a farewell visit to him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Space Is Common Wealth: KCNA White Paper
articles.content:
Space Is Common Wealth: KCNA White Paper

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency released white paper "Space Is Common Wealth of Humankind" Monday.
					
					 Referring to the global trend for space development, the white paper disclosed the U.S. ambition for space monopolization aimed at world domination.
					
					 It said:
					
					 Different countries and nations regard it as their strategic goals to advance into vast space, which serves as a powerful engine propelling the future development of science and technology as well as economy. 
					
					 Space technologies have made leaping progress in various fields including telecommunications, public health, seed production and energy whose achievements have opened up the prospect for the effective use of space for human civilization and development. 
					
					 New economy called space economy is thriving encompassing the production of all kinds of goods and services in the course of space activities. 
					
					 The competition for space development gained fresh momentum among countries in recent years. 
					
					 Last year a total of 118 space modules were launched by carrier rockets into their orbits to go around the earth. 
					
					 Even developing countries buckled down to the activities to conquer space, injecting fresh vitality into the worldwide competition for space development. 
					
					 The DPRK joined the Outer Space Treaty and the Convention on Registration of Objects Launched into Outer Space. It successfully launched satellite Kwangmyongsong-2 by rocket carrier Unha-2 into the space on April 5, 2009 after going through the procedures concerning international law.
					
					 The U.S. and its allies, by abusing the UN Security Council, took issue with the DPRK's peaceful satellite launch.
					
					 Members of the U.S. House of Representatives recently submitted a bill banning the DPRK, China and some other countries from launching satellites.
					
					 This is aimed to bar the sovereign countries from making legitimate advance into space, and monopolize it.
					
					 The U.S. has long spurred the scenario for converting the space into the theatre of a war for realizing its strategy for world domination.
					
					 It openly disclosed its ambition for monopolizing the space in the new century.
					
					 After the September 11 incident, the U.S. announced a "war on terrorism" and began advocating new "space military principle".
					
					 On December 13, 2001 the then U.S. President Bush announced its unilateral withdrawal from the 1972 ABM treaty.
					
					 Since then it has opted for removing stumbling blocks in the way of developing space weapons and buckled down to putting its scenario for a space war into practice.
					
					 After officially formulating space monopolization as its national policy, the U.S. unhesitatingly put into practice its strategy for putting the world under its control with the use of space.
					
					 In October 2006 the U.S. made public "national space policy" to the effect that it rejects any international disarmament agreement that may deter it from making military advance into space and using it, and that it has the right to prevent those countries hurting the U.S. interests from advancing into space, if necessary.
					
					 The U.S. actually used space technologies for fighting a "war on terrorism" and other aggression wars, revealing its moves for using the space for the purpose of military aggression.
					
					 The U.S. attempt to use the space for military purposes geared to holding hegemony will harass global peace and jeopardize human existence.
					
					 No one can check the trend of the times toward the exploration of space for prosperity common to humankind and peaceful purposes.

articles.title: KCNA to Shortly Start Chinese Service
articles.content:
KCNA to Shortly Start Chinese Service

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency will start reporting articles, photos and movies in Chinese from Dec. 1 with homepage address--http://www.kcna.kp.
					
					 It is occasioned by the 65th anniversary of KCNA. It will contribute to boosting traditional friendship between the DPRK and China and promoting the understanding of the DPRK by a great number of Chinese speaking population.

articles.title: GFTUK Delegation back Home
articles.content:
GFTUK Delegation back Home

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea headed by Chairman of Its Central Committee Hyon Sang Ju came back home on Tuesday after visiting Syria.

articles.title: 63rd Anniversary of DPRK-Bulgaria Diplomatic Ties Marked
articles.content:
63rd Anniversary of DPRK-Bulgaria Diplomatic Ties Marked

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A film show was held to mark the 63rd anniversary of establishment of the DPRK-Bulgaria diplomatic ties at the People's Palace of Culture in Pyongyang on Tuesday.
					
					 Among the audience were Vice-Chairman Ryu Sung Rim and other members of the DPRK-Bulgaria Friendship Association, working people in the city and Vihren Nikolov, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Bulgarian embassy here. 
					
					 They saw a Bulgarian feature film.

articles.title: Korean People Condemn S. Korea's War Exercise
articles.content:
Korean People Condemn S. Korea's War Exercise

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army released a report on Thursday as regards the anti-DPRK war exercise launched by the south Korean military on five islands and their surrounding waters in the West Sea of Korea a year after the Yonphyong Island shelling.
					
					 The Korean people, upon receiving the report, are bitterly accusing the south Korean military of the DPRK-targeted exercise.
					
					 Pak Jong Gwon, a department director of the Ministry of Metal Industry, told KCNA:
					
					 "The reckless war exercise launched by the south Korean military in the West Sea of Korea, far from drawing due lesson from the Yonphyong Island shelling, is tantamount to a downright challenge and declaration of war against the DPRK. 
					
					 If they dare to fire even a single bullet or shell toward its inviolable territorial waters, sky and land, our army will sweep away their stronghold."
					
					 Ri Chol Jin, a 46-year-old worker of the Pyongyang Bearing Factory, said:
					
					 "It is the DPRK's mode of counteraction to react the enemy's military provocation with a stern punishment. We will work hard to build a strong economy with a rifle in one hand and a hammer in the other."
					
					 Kwak Suk Yong, a 20-year-old student of Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry, strongly denounced the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea for seeking confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 "If the south Korean military dare to ignite a war, I will join in the army to defend the country," she said.

articles.title: DPRK Economic Experts Censure S. Korea-US FTA
articles.content:
DPRK Economic Experts Censure S. Korea-US FTA

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Economic experts of the DPRK are criticizing the free trade agreement (FTA) between south Korea and the United States.
					
					 Kim Sang Hak, a section chief of the Economic Institute of the Academy of Social Sciences, told KCNA that FTA is encountering a strong opposition from south Korean people as it is a humiliating and unequal agreement. 
					
					 He went on to say:
					
					 South Korea and the United States concluded FTA in June 2007.
					
					 The agreement stipulated that the United States should abolish tariffs step by step for autos imported from south Korea and the latter can limit auto imports from the former.
					
					 With U.S. auto makers disliking the agreement, it had failed to be approved by U.S. Congress. The United States demanded renegotiations and south Korea accepted the demand in December 3 last year. The two sides amended the auto trade part of FTA and signed it again in February.
					
					 The amended agreement stipulates that high tariffs should be kept in years for south Korean autos and even though the tariffs are eliminated, the United States can levy a custom duty on them again any time by invoking emergency import curbs.  
					
					 Meanwhile, south Korea should halve customs for U.S.-made autos as soon as the agreement goes into effect and eliminate them after four years. 
					
					 Viewed from international law and practice, it is uncommon to amend what two sides agreed already. But the humiliating agreement came into being due to the U.S. arrogance and shamelessness and the south Korean pro-U.S. sycophantic and treacherous policy. 
					
					 FTA serves as an indication of the relationship between the metropolitan state and colony and between the master and servant. 
					
					 Generally speaking, a free trade agreement calls for abolishing all tariffs and nontariff barriers and ensuring free transfer of goods and capital. It is clear to everyone who will be the victim in case south Korea, much smaller than the United States in the economic scope and dependent on the latter in capital and technology, concludes such an agreement with it.
					
					 The unequal agreement has seven mandatory articles for the U.S. but 55 mandatory articles for south Korea.
					
					 Kim Kwang Nam, another section chief of the same institute, said:
					
					 The humiliating and unequal agreement was rattled through the south Korean "National Assembly" to become effective next year.
					
					 If the agreement comes into effect, the south Korean economy will be fully subordinate to the U.S. economy, inviting a serious result.
					
					 The biggest victim will be south Korea's agriculture.
					
					 According to south Korea's Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry, Fisheries and Foodstuffs, south Korean agricultural and fishing domains will suffer a loss of more than 12 trillion won in 15 years. Of the figure, more than 7 trillion won loss will go to the stockbreeding domain. 
					
					 South Korean people term FTA a "coercive agreement maximizing the U.S. interests" and "second Ulsa five-point treaty". 
					
					 Through the conclusion of FTA the Lee Myung Bak conservative regime has sold out the dignity and interests of the south Korean people to the United States.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Keeping Keyed-up Attitude to Advance Surge
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Keeping Keyed-up Attitude to Advance Surge

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- All the party members and other working people should maintain the keyed-up attitude to accelerate the on-going advance of a great surge for final victory by resolutely shattering the military provocations of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean group of traitors. Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in an editorial. 
					
					 It is the revolutionary temperament of the army and people of the DPRK to effect a great surge in socialist construction while keeping themselves fully combat ready to cope with the enemies' reckless provocations and war moves, the editorial says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean group of traitors are going on the rampage, escalating confrontation with the DPRK, oblivious of the lesson taught by the Yonphyong Island shelling. This situation requires the party members and other working people to live and work in more alert and mobilized posture than ever before. 
					
					 The building of a thriving nation is militarily guaranteed and the advance of the great surge is being dynamically pushed forward thanks to the key role of the Korean People's Army. The reality convinces the people of victory and reinforces their optimism. 
					
					 All the servicepersons and people live and work in the revolutionary soldier spirit, united close around the headquarters of the revolution. Herein lies the tremendous politico-ideological might and invincible spirit of Songun Korea. 
					
					 "Return retaliation for retaliation, all-out war for all-out war!" This is the invariable will of the army and people of the DPRK. 
					
					 The DPRK is determined to continue socialist construction till midnight even though a war is supposed to break out the next day and mercilessly destroy the aggressors through the heroic death-defying battle involving party, army and the people. If the enemies dare hurt the dignity of the DPRK and fire even a single shell or bullet into its inviolable sea, air and land, it will make the flame on Yonphyong Island to flare up into roaring flames in Chongwadae and the stronghold of the group of traitors. 
					
					 No force on earth can overwhelm the might of the single-minded unity of the servicepersons and people united close around the headquarters of the revolution. All of them should bring about a great surge in every worksite with matchless bravery and high spirit of annihilating the enemy following the flame kindled in South Hamgyong Province.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blames S. Korea for Coiling up Tension
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blames S. Korea for Coiling up Tension

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The frayed north-south ties and the tensions running high on the Korean Peninsula are attributable to the south Korean conservative authorities' dangerous racket for military confrontation with the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a bylined article.
					
					 Blaming the stalled north-south relations on the military confrontation racket, the article goes on:
					
					 The north-south relations have reached the lowest ebb and extreme tensions and the danger of a war mounted in the Korean Peninsula. This is an inevitable result of the confrontation racket kicked up by the south Korean warmongers.
					
					 The present south Korean authorities totally denied the dialogue and cooperation with the compatriots and worked with bloodshot eyes to realize their ambition of invading the DPRK through military confrontation. The incidents of warship "Cheonan" and the Yonphyong Island shelling clearly proved the dangerous and reckless nature of the south Korean warmongers' military racket aimed to ignite a new war even by hurting the north-south reconciliation and unity.
					
					 This confrontation racket ruined the north-south relations and increased the danger of a war against the DPRK. They can never flee from the responsibility for having hindered north-south dialogue and cooperation and escalated the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Detente, peace and improvement of the north-south relations are the common desire and wish of all the Koreans. Even those countries around the peninsula are becoming assertive calling for holding talks and mending the north-south relations.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group, however, runs headlong into military confrontation with the DPRK, defying the will for a switchover in the "policy towards the DPRK".
					
					 Its military confrontation racket will end up in its ultimate ruin.

articles.title: S. Korean PM's War Outbursts Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean PM's War Outbursts Flayed

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- South Korean puppet Prime Minister Kim Hwang Sik at a "memorial" on November 23 was impudent enough to term the Yonphyong Island incident the DPRK's "indiscriminate shelling" on the territory of south Korea. 
					
					 Kim, a guy of bereft of reason, called for paying respect to the dead. He went the lengths of letting loose a spate of such extreme war outbursts as taking "resolute counteraction" and "establishing firm national defense attitude to neutralize provocation".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 His despicable behavior is aimed to cover up the truth of the incident and escalate the confrontation with the DPRK under the pretext of coping with "provocation".
					
					 No rhetoric about someone's "provocation" can ever change the truth of the incident. The DPRK was quite just when it took the self-defensive countermeasure against the live-shell firing exercises staged by the puppet forces.
					
					 Kim, however, turning a blind eye to the objective reality, talked about the "atrocities" and the like. He is, indeed, a war maniac who would put the military hooligans into the shade although he goes in plainclothes. 
					
					 His powder-reeking outbursts make it difficult to judge whether he is "prime minister" or "defense minister".
					
					 His behavior proved that the south Korean conservative group is preoccupied with escalating the north-south confrontation and stirring up the war atmosphere against the north, clean indifferent to misfortune and pain it may inflict on the people. 
					
					 They would be well advised to clearly understand that only a miserable death awaits those who pursue the north-south confrontation going against the people's mindset.

articles.title: Invasion of DPRK Is S. Korea's Unchanged Ambition: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Invasion of DPRK Is S. Korea's Unchanged Ambition: Minju Joson

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean warmongers staged the exercise of "attacking the base of provocation and assistance forces" on the first anniversary of the Yonphyong Island shelling. A bylined commentary of Minju Joson on Tuesday terms it an open expression of the south Korean warmongers' attempt to light a fuse and start an all-out war against the DPRK by any means.
					
					 The puppet warmongers, obsessed by confrontation and war against their fellow countrymen, consider the five islands in the West Sea of Korea as a starting position and an outpost base for launching the war, the commentary said, adding:
					
					 The war exercise proved it is an unchanged ambition of the puppet warmongers to invade the DPRK.
					
					 If the puppet warmongers had any interest in peace and security in the Korean Peninsula, they should have sincerely apologized for the last year's clumsy shelling and taken measures to prevent the repetition of similar incidents.
					
					 But they designated the army and people of the DPRK as "apparent enemies" and made a new war rule of "action first and report second" and have stepped up the war preparations, crying out for "retaliation" and "chastisement".
					
					 If the puppet warmongers commit provocation against the DPRK, forgetful of the last year's lesson, they would be doomed.
					
					 They should behave with discretion, mindful of the warning issued by the DPRK that the flame on Yonphyong Island will spread to Chongwadae.

articles.title: Japan SDF's Integrated Military Drill under Fire
articles.content:
Japan SDF's Integrated Military Drill under Fire

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Japan "Self-Defense Forces" held an integrated military drill across Japan from Nov. 14 to 18. 
					
					 Japan claimed the drill is of "defensive" nature but it is nothing but a smokescreen to deceive public opinion at home and abroad and cover up its criminal nature, says Minju Joson Tuesday in a bylined commentary. It goes on:
					
					 Japan is a military ally of the U.S. and receives military security guarantee including a "nuclear umbrella" from it. In fact, Japan is not exposed to any military threat now in view of the political situation in Northeast Asia. 
					
					 But, it staged the military drill under the pretence of "bolstering defense posture". This is aimed at acquiring capabilities for holding military supremacy in Asia as early as possible. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries have long dreamed of becoming the leader of Asia by turning the island into a military power. They are persisting in the moves to convert it into a military giant, while openly saying that its failed ambition of the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" was attributable to its weakness. 
					
					 The Japan SDF has now become powerful enough to overpower world first-class army. 
					
					 The military indexes of Japan have already gone far beyond the limit of defence. It is illogic for Japan to assert that the excessively expanded SDF would be exclusively used for defence purpose only. 
					
					 Japan has already defined the military operations overseas as one of the basic duties of SDF. 
					
					 What remains to be done by Japan is to steadily increase the SDF's operation and combat capabilities and on its basis intensify the military operations overseas.
					
					 Japan is still obsessed with retrieving its past defeat and covets the leadership of Asia. Japan's military advance overseas will, therefore, endanger world peace and security.

articles.title: Railroaded "Motion for Ratification of FTA" Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Railroaded "Motion for Ratification of FTA" Denounced in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- At least 3,000 people from all walks of life held a candlelight rally in Seoul on November 26 to denounce the "Grand National Party" for railroading the "motion for ratification of Free Trade Agreement". They included those of opposition parties and members of the Headquarters of the All-People Movement for Checking the Conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement.
					
					 Speakers called on all the people to turn out to render the motion invalid by all means and mete out punishment to the ruling forces.
					
					 The authorities hurled the police to the scene to encircle the venue but people will never give up but respond with more vigorous candlelight actions, they said.
					
					 After the rally the protesters marched toward Chongwadae defying the police cordon.
					
					 Other people joined the demonstrators, bringing the number to more than 10,000.

articles.title: Koreans in China Denounce S. Korean War Exercise
articles.content:
Koreans in China Denounce S. Korean War Exercise

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China made public a statement on Nov. 26 denouncing the south Korean puppet military warmongers for their anti-DPRK confrontation campaign. 
					
					 The statement referred to the fact that the south Korean military warmongers staged a big anti-DPRK war exercise in the area of five islands in the West Sea of Korea and their surrounding waters one year after the Yonphyong Island shelling.
					
					 The Yonphyong Island shelling last year was the just measure taken by the DPRK for self-defence to counter the south Korean provokers who preempted shelling into the inviolable waters of the DPRK, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Nevertheless, they staged another large war exercise, far from drawing a due lesson from the incident. This was a renewed political and military provocation. 
					
					 They should not go reckless, mindful of the grave consequences to be entailed by their anti-DPRK war moves. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop the war moves, clearly understanding that following the U.S. moves for aggression of the DPRK is a traitorous criminal act against national reunification. 
					
					 If the provokers finally ignite a war in Korea, we, together with the people in the homeland, will mount merciless and annihilating strike on them and wipe out the warmongers from this planet.

articles.title: Cambodian King Meets DPRK Ambassador
articles.content:
Cambodian King Meets DPRK Ambassador

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The friendly and cooperative relations between Cambodia and the DPRK are historic and special relations as they were forged by Great King Norodom Sihanouk and Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, the great leader of the Korean people. Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni said this when meeting with the DPRK ambassador to Cambodia on Nov. 24.
					
					 The traditional relations have been steadily developed thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people, the king said, adding:
					
					 I am convinced that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.
					
					 I extend heartfelt thanks to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for their great support and encouragement to the great king and the Cambodian people.
					
					 I highly appreciate and sincerely congratulate the fraternal Korean people upon their great achievements in socialist construction under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Cambodian government and people will as ever positively support and encourage the Korean people's cause of building a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: PPC Meets DPRK Ambassador
articles.content:
PPC Meets DPRK Ambassador

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The People's Party of Cambodia (PPC) is attaching special importance to the relations with the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). Chea Sim, chairman of the Central Committee of the PPC, said this when meeting Ri In Sok, DPRK ambassador to Cambodia, who paid a farewell call on him on Nov. 23.
					
					 The PPC and the WPK have long kept the close friendly relations, Chea Sim said, and went on:
					
					 The two parties have steadily developed the relations through exchange of many high-ranking delegations in the past.
					
					 Our party and government will as ever closely cooperate with the WPK and the DPRK government.
					
					 We are rejoiced over the great achievements made by the WPK and Korean people in socialist construction under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and sincerely congratulate them.

articles.title: Meeting in Tokyo Call for Normalizing DPRK-Japan Ties
articles.content:
Meeting in Tokyo Call for Normalizing DPRK-Japan Ties

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A general meeting and lecture of the Liaison Council for Demanding Denuclearization and Peace in Northeast Asia and Normalization of the Relations between Japan and the DPRK took place in Tokyo on Nov. 21.
					
					 Associate Prof. of Rikkyo University Koichi Ishizaka, co-representative and secretary general of the liaison council, in a report at the event reviewed the past one year's activities of the liaison council. He denounced the Japanese government for extending the term of sanctions against the DPRK as well as watching, suppressing and discriminating Koreans in Japan.
					
					 He demanded the Japanese authorities make apology and reparation for the crimes Japan committed during its colonial rule over Korea.
					
					 He underlined the need to conduct more dynamic movement to end discrimination against Korean schools that has become undisguised across Japan.
					
					 Honorary Prof. of Hitotsubashi University Hiroshi Tanaka and Honorary Prof. of Tokyo University Haruki Wada who are advisors to the liaison council delivered lectures on the system of aiding Korean schools and the 10th anniversary of the adoption of the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration.
					
					 An appeal was adopted at the event. It demanded the Japanese authorities resume the talks for normalizing Japan-DPRK diplomatic relations at an early date and stressed the need to build up public opinion to facilitate the normalization of the bilateral diplomatic relations on the 10th anniversary of the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration.
					
					 The appeal urged the Japanese authorities to apply the system of aiding Korean schools as soon as possible.

articles.title: Songun Politics Praised
articles.content:
Songun Politics Praised

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army. A seminar and a film show were held in Romania and an opening ceremony of the DPRK photo exhibition week in Nigeria from Nov. 18 to 22.
					
					 The chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Bucharest of Romania in a speech said that Kim Jong Il has strengthened the single-minded unity of all the service persons and people and state power in every way through his Songun politics, thereby more firmly consolidating the DPRK into the invincible socialist fortress.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would make greater achievements in the efforts to bring about prosperity under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The director of the Nigeria-Korea Stereo Industrial Company in a speech noted: Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the KPA was an event of epochal significance in defending and glorifying Korean socialism.
					
					 The foundation of Korean socialism has been more firmly consolidated and socialist construction could advance triumphantly as Kim Jong Il formulated the Songun politics as the basic political mode under socialism and applied it to all fields, he stressed.

articles.title: Chinese Officials Urged to Take Part in Politics Honestly
articles.content:
Chinese Officials Urged to Take Part in Politics Honestly

					 Beijing, November 28 (KCNA) -- A Chinese official called on cadres of the Communist Party of China (CPC) to take part in politics honestly.
					
					 Addressing a meeting held in Beijing recently, He Yong, member of the Secretariat of the CPC Central Committee, said the special supervision and inspection should be strengthened to encourage cadres to take part in political activities in an upright and honest way. 
					
					 All supervision and inspection groups should sincerely study party's policies and make substantial achievements in their work with a strong sense of responsibility and good style of work, he added.

articles.title: China Calls for Expanding Multilateral Cooperation
articles.content:
China Calls for Expanding Multilateral Cooperation

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Chinese permanent representative to the United Nations called for strengthening multilateral cooperation to cope with threats to the world security.
					
					 Speaking at a recent meeting of the UN Security Council, Li Baodong said the world is still harassed by such problems threatening security as war, armed conflict, territorial dispute, terrorism and organized crime.
					
					 To cope with such threats, the international community should expand multilateral cooperation and take a collective action, Li added.

articles.title: China's Communication Satellite Launched
articles.content:
China's Communication Satellite Launched

					 Moscow, November 28 (KCNA) -- Russia launched China's communication satellite "Asiasat-7" from the Baikonur Space Centre on November 25.
					
					 The satellite, carried by rocket Proton-M, was successfully put into orbit, a media report said.

articles.title: Russia Accuses Western's Sanctions against Iran
articles.content:
Russia Accuses Western's Sanctions against Iran

					 Moscow, November 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Russian Foreign Ministry recently accused the West's sanctions against Iran.
					
					 Some Western countries' decision to apply additional sanctions against Iran will destroy the international efforts to establish the constructive dialogue relations with this country and aggravate the tensions, he said. There arises a question that expansion of the sanctions is being used for any other aim unrelated with the settlement of Iran's nuclear issue, he noted.
					
					 It is the invariable stand of Russia that Iran's nuclear issue should be settled politically and diplomatically, he stressed.

articles.title: Russian Officials Support President's Tough Step over MD
articles.content:
Russian Officials Support President's Tough Step over MD

					 Moscow, November 28 (KCNA) -- Deputies to Russia's State Duma, in a news conference some days ago, voiced support for the tough step taken by President Dmitri Medvedev as regards the United States' missile defense system (MD).
					
					 The first vice-chairman of the Committee of International Affairs of the State Duma said the deadlocked MD talks have prompted him to take such a step. "It clearly proves that no result brings no cooperation," he added.
					
					 The first vice-chairman of the Committee of External Policy stressed Russia can not make a concession to the U.S. and NATO, saying, "Otherwise, they will trample on us."

articles.title: Russia Threatens Countermeasures against MD
articles.content:
Russia Threatens Countermeasures against MD

					 Moscow, November 28 (KCNA) -- Russia's deputy defense minister recently threatened countermeasures to cope with the missile defense system (MD) of the United States.
					
					 Anatoly Antonov criticized the United States for unilaterally pushing ahead with the plan to establish MD in Europe, while the Russia-U.S. MD talks have been held for months.
					
					 Russia's all measures to counter MD depend on how the situation develops, Antonov said.
					
					 If there is no action to neutralize Russia's nuclear deterrent, there will not be any military and technological countermeasure, the deputy minister added.

articles.title: Anti-terrorism Drill Held by Russian Military Units
articles.content:
Anti-terrorism Drill Held by Russian Military Units

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Tajikistan-based Russian military units staged an anti-terrorism drill in their firing ranges some days ago.
					
					 The drill was aimed to increase the capabilities of combating terrorism.
					
					 Prior the drill, an inspection of the anti-terrorism groups was conducted without an advance notice.

articles.title: AIDS Epidemic in US Remains at "Unacceptable High" Level
articles.content:
AIDS Epidemic in US Remains at "Unacceptable High" Level

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- There are about 1.1 million people infected with HIV in the U.S., according to a recent survey data of the country.
					
					 The U.S. has seen close to 600,000 AIDS-related death.

articles.title: Iran's President Refers to Peaceful Purpose of Its Nuclear Program
articles.content:
Iran's President Refers to Peaceful Purpose of Its Nuclear Program

					 Tehran, November 28 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad in an interview with a TV on Nov. 26 referred to the peaceful purpose of its nuclear program.
					
					 Iran does not seek the manufacturing of nuclear bombs, he said, adding that the aim of Iran is to have access to peaceful nuclear technology to develop various economic fields such as atomic power, medicine, industry and agriculture.
					
					 The stand of China and Russia in many international issues is closer to the stand of Iran than that of the U.S. and its allies, he declared.

articles.title: Iran's FM Refers to NAM Role
articles.content:
Iran's FM Refers to NAM Role

					 Tehran, November 28 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Salehi in a speech at an international meeting on Nov. 24 referred to the role of the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM).
					
					 He said that the primary purpose for establishing NAM was to confront the political and cultural dominance and hegemony of the global powers. 
					
					 NAM members will try to play their role to preserve the cultural diversity and promotion of human rights, he added.

articles.title: Iran to Stage Military Exercise in Int'l Waters
articles.content:
Iran to Stage Military Exercise in Int'l Waters

					 Tehran, November 28 (KCNA) -- Iran's navy plans to stage a large-scale military exercise in international waters in the near future. 
					
					 The military exercise, to be codenamed "Belayat 90", will cover a wide scope ranging from the Oman Sea to the northern part of the Indian Ocean. 
					
					 The navy commander Saturday announced that the exercise involving latest-type military equipment is aimed to demonstrate the navy's capabilities of safeguarding the country's security.

articles.title: Pakistani Military Condemns NATO's Air Raid
articles.content:
Pakistani Military Condemns NATO's Air Raid

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Pakistani military in a statement on Nov. 26 strongly condemned NATO's illegal air raid.
					
					 On Nov. 25 NATO's helicopters fired an army examination post in northwest Pakistan, killing 25 innocent soldiers and leaving 14 others wounded. In this regard the statement said NATO's army set indiscriminate firing.
					
					 In protest against this, the Pakistani government closed major point passing the border used for materials supply to NATO's army in Afghanistan.

articles.title: Cooperation among Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Countries

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- China and Venezuela agreed to boost bilateral relations in the fields of energy, telecom and agriculture on Nov. 24.
					
					 On Nov. 21 the member countries of the East African Community agreed to construct an oil and gas infrastructure.

articles.title: South African President Refers to Elimination of Poverty
articles.content:
South African President Refers to Elimination of Poverty

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- South African President Jacob Zuma, addressing a recent event, referred to the issue of eliminating the poverty.
					
					 The government launched a new rural development initiative. 
					
					 This is a programme for the people, by the people," he noted, adding: The initiative is aimed to alleviate poverty and fight hunger in some of the country's poorest rural areas.
					
					 He called upon all the people to turn out in this work.

articles.title: Cambodia's Parliament Adopts Draft Law on Drug Control
articles.content:
Cambodia's Parliament Adopts Draft Law on Drug Control

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Cambodia's National Assembly on Friday passed the draft law on drug control, aimed at enhancing the country's effectiveness in fighting against drug trafficking.
					
					 The new law applies punishment on wrong-doers twice heavier than the old one.

articles.title: Flood Damage Increases in Thailand
articles.content:
Flood Damage Increases in Thailand

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Flood damage is increasing in Thailand. The flood left 615 persons dead and three others missing as of Nov. 27. Over 13 million or one in every five Thais have been affected. Many industrial establishments were inundated. The government is taking steps to eradicate the aftermath.

articles.title: European Economy Becomes Worse: EC President
articles.content:
European Economy Becomes Worse: EC President

					 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The president of the European Commission on November 23 expressed serious concern over the economic situation of Europe.
					
					 Introducing the commission's recommendations for improving the European economic situation, Jose Manuel Barroso said the current economic situation of Europe has become worse than in January.

articles.title: Premier coreano recorre la Academia Estatal de Ciencias
articles.content:
Premier coreano recorre la Academia Estatal de Ciencias

					   Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim estudio el dia 27 en el terreno la Academia Estatal de Ciencias de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					   Al cabo de dar vueltas por diversos lugares del citado organo, Choe organizo una reunion de consulta, en la cual se debatieron los problemas de que los cientificos y los tecnicos deben hacer gran aporte a la mejora de la vida del pueblo con los logros de punta y responder a la confianza y la esperanza del partido y de que las unidades relacionadas deben prestar primordial atencion a ofrecer las condiciones necesarias a las labores cientificas y tecnicas. 
					
					   Con anterioridad, el premier hizo conocimiento del estado de gestion de la Fabrica Textil de Pyongyang y del Circo de Pyongyang y tomo las medidas correspondientes.

articles.title: ACNC revela ambicion de EE.UU. de apoderarse del cosmos
articles.content:
ACNC revela ambicion de EE.UU. de apoderarse del cosmos

					Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- La Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea (ACNC) hizo publica el dia 28 la carta blanca intitulada "El cosmos es la riqueza comun de la humanidad". 
					
					La nota aclara la tendencia mundial al desarrollo cosmico y pone al desnudo la ambicion de Estados Unidos de apoderarse del universo para tomar la supremacia mundial. 
					
					El cosmos es la riqueza comun de la humanidad, senala la nota y continua: 
					
					El avance al vasto espacio universal, que sirve de fuerza motriz del desarrollo de la ciencia, la tecnica y la economia del futuro, es la meta estrategica de varios paises y naciones del mundo. 
					
					La tecnologia universal se desarrolla vertiginosamente en varios dominios incluso la comunicacion, la salud publica, el mejoramiento de variedades y la energia, cuyos exitos abren la perspectiva favorable a aprovechar eficientemente el cosmos para la civilizacion y el desarrollo de toda la humanidad. 
					
					 Alcanza un desarrollo rapido una nueva rama economica llamada la economia universal, que abarca los servicios y los productos de toda indole que se producen en las actividades espaciales. 
					
					En los ultimos anos se activa la competencia entre los paises para la explotacion del cosmos. 
					
					Solo el ano pasado entraron 118 aparatos espaciales en la orbita de la Tierra gracias al lanzamiento de los cohetes transportadores. 
					
					La competencia mundial de explotacion del cosmos se hace mas renida, porque hasta los paises en vias de desarrollo se incorporan activamente a las actividades para conquistar el cosmos. 
					
					La Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ingreso al Tratado Espacial y al Convenio sobre Registro de Objetos Lanzados en el Espacio Universal. Y al seguir el orden internacional, lanzo con exito el 5 de abril de 2009 el satelite artificial "Kwangmyongsong no. 2" mediante el cohete transportador "Unha-2". 
					
					Sin embargo, EE.UU. y sus fuerzas satelites acusaron atrevidamente a la RPDC del lanzamiento de este satelite con fines pacificos abusando del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU. 
					
					Los miembros de la camara de representantes de EE.UU. sometieron a la consideracion de esta un proyecto de ley sobre la prohibicion del lanzamiento de satelites artificiales de algunos paises incluso a la RPDC y China. 
					
					Esto parte de la ambicion de bloquear  el uso legitimo de los Estados soberanos al espacio universal y monopolizar el cosmos. 
					
					Desde hace mucho tiempo, EE.UU. vino acelerando la militarizacion espacial para utilizar el espacio universal como un campo de guerra favorable a la realizacion de su estrategia de tomar la supremacia mundial. 
					
					En el nuevo siglo, EE.UU. revela mas abiertamente su ambicion monopolista sobre el cosmos. 
					
					Despues del incidente del 11 de septiembre, el imperio declaro la guerra "antiterrorista" y preconizo un nuevo "principio militar universal". 
					
					El 13 de diciembre de 2001, el presidente estadounidense de aquel entonces, Bush, declaro la retirada unilateral de su pais del Tratado sobre Misiles Antibalisticos. 
					
					De esta manera, EE.UU. elimino los aparatos que frenaban el desarrollo de armas espaciales e impulso activamente la realizacion del plan de guerra cosmica. 
					
					EE.UU. fijo oficialmente el uso monopolista del cosmos como su politica estatal y puso en practica la estrategia de supremacia mundial mediante el espacio universal. 
					
					En octubre de 2006 EE.UU. hizo publica la "politica estatal sobre el cosmos", segun la cual EE.UU. se opone a todos los acuerdos de desarme internacionales que prohiban el avance militar y el uso del pais sobre el espacio universal y tiene el derecho a frenar la salida al universo de un pais hostil a intereses de EE.UU. 
					
					De veras, el imperio utiliza la tecnologia espacial a la guerra de agresion como la "guerra antiterrorista". De esta manera, revelo claramente su designio agresivo de militarizar el cosmos. 
					
					La intencion de militarizar el cosmos y aprovecharlo al proposito dominacionista es un crimen que pone en peligro la paz del mundo y la subsistencia de la humanidad. 
					
					Con nada puede detener la corriente de la epoca contra la militarizacion espacial y hacia el desarrollo pacifico del cosmos por la prosperidad comun de la humanidad.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun exhorta a acelerar la marcha de gran auge
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun exhorta a acelerar la marcha de gran auge

					Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- En el editorial del dia 29, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que todos los militantes del partido y los trabajadores deben frustrar rotundamente las provocaciones militares de Estados Unidos y de la banda traidora del Sur de Corea y acelerar con mas dinamismo la marcha de gran auge de hoy por la victoria final, manteniendo continua y firmemente el estado de alerta y de disposicion combativa.
					
					Por mas que los enemigos recurran con mas frenesi a las imprudentes provocaciones y las maniobras de guerra, el ejercito y el pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea registran mas auge en la construccion socialista manteniendo la disposicion combativa, lo cual es su temperamento revolucionario, subraya  el editorial y continua:
					
					La situacion de hoy en que EE.UU. y la banda traidora surcoreana se entregan con imprudencia a las maniobras conflictivas anti-RPDC sin tener presente la leccion del caso de fuego artillero en la isla Yonphyong, demanda a los militantes del partido y los trabajadores vivir y trabajar en estado mas alerto y combativo que nunca. 
					
					En la actualidad la construccion del Estado prospero se asegura en lo militar y la marcha de gran auge se impulsa fuertemente por el papel medular del ejercito popular, centuplicando al pueblo coreano la conviccion en la victoria y el optimismo.  
					
					Todos los militares y los civiles, unidos compactamente en torno a la Direccion de la Revolucion, viven y luchan con el espiritu revolucionario de los militares. He aqui el inagotable poderio ideo-politico y el impetu de la Corea del Songun. 
					
					!Responder con represalia a la represalia y con la guerra total a la guerra total!
					
					Esto es la invariable voluntad del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea.
					
					Aunque se desate manana la guerra, hay que continuar hasta las doce de esta noche la construccion socialista y desplegar manana el combate decisivo de todo el partido, todo el ejercito y todo el pueblo para aniquilar implacablemente a los agresores. Esto es la decision de Corea.
					
					Si los enemigos se atreven a manchar nuestra dignidad y disparar, aunque sea una bala y una bomba, hacia el sagrado mar, el cielo y la tierra jurisdiccionales de nuestra parte, la isla Yonphyong sera convertida en un mar de fuego y sus llamas se extenderan a Chongwadae (casa azul) y hasta el nido de la banda de traidores.
					
					Nadie en este mundo puede quebrantar la unidad monolitica del ejercito y el pueblo en torno a la Direccion de la Revolucion.
					
					Todo el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea deben registrar los asaltos en todos los campos de gran auge con el invencible coraje y el impetu de aniquilar a los enemigos, siguiendo el auge de produccion en la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur.

articles.title: MInju Joson denuncia ejercicios belicos combinados en Japon
articles.content:
MInju Joson denuncia ejercicios belicos combinados en Japon

					Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Japon desarrollo desde el dia 14 hasta el 18 en escala nacional los ejercicios belicos de gran envergadura de las "fuerzas terrestres, navales y aereas de autodefensa" bajo el rotulo de "defensa". 
					
					El periodico Minju Joson, en un comentario individual de este martes, lo califica de una cortina para enganar la opinion publica interna y externa y encubrir el caracter criminal del presente simulacro, y continua:
					
					Japon tiene la alianza militar con EE.UU. que le garantiza la seguridad militar y le ofrece el "paraguas nuclear". 
					
					En efecto, en la situacion politica actual del Nordeste Asiatico Japon no tiene ninguna amenaza militar. 
					
					Sin embargo, el pais isleno se entrega a los ejercicios militares hablando del "fortalecimiento de la disposicion de defensa" bajo el designio de disponer cuanto antes la capacidad necesaria a tomar la supremacia militar en Asia. 
					
					Convertirse en la potencia militar y actuar como dueno de Asia es la ambicion antigua de los reaccionarios japoneses. 
					
					Estos recurren persistentemente a la conversion del pais en la potencia militar, diciendo abiertamente que no pudieron realizar la ambicion de la "esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia Oriental" por sus fuerzas debiles. 
					
					Hoy dia, las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" de Japon se han reforzado tanto como un ejercito de primera clase en el mundo. 
					
					Los indices militares de Japon ya pasan el limite de la defensa. 
					
					El pais isleno ya definio las actividades militares en ultramar como una de las misiones principales de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa". 
					
					Ahora les hace falta mejorar constantemente la capacidad de operaciones y de combate de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" y a base de ello, ampliar las actividades militares en ultramar. 
					
					El avance a ultramar de Japon deviene una gran amenaza a la paz y la seguridad del mundo.
